column1: No apparent damage to the daisy chain. All bar tacks intact.
No apparent damage to the daisy chain. All bar tacks intact.
No apparent damage to the daisy chain. All bar tacks intact.
Visible damage - first bar tack proximal to the load totally blown out. Girth hitch of the test unit to the shackle extremely difficult to release nylon welding noted inside of girth hitch.
Girth hitch easy to remove. Three sets of bar tacks blown out from anchor side of test unit.
1 Nylon Webbing w/ adjustable cam buckle - Nylon -
Unit was preset with aprox. 20cm of available tail prior to drop. Shorty Screamer completely deployed. Girth hitch easy to remove. Slight deformation of cam buckle noted.
1 Nylon Webbing w/ adjustable cam buckle - Nylon -
Unit was pre -set with ≈20cm of available tail prior to drop. Shorty Screamer completely deployed. Daisy appeared to have failed at the cam buckle location.
1 Nylon Webbing w/ adjustable cam buckle - Nylon -
Unit was pre-set with aprox. 20cm of available tail prior to drop. Failure noted at cam buckle location.
Three bar tacks blown apart (proximal to anchor side).
Shorty Screamer fully deployed. No apparent damage to daisy chain.
Daisy chain failed at first pocket proximal to the anchor side.
Daisy chain failed at girth hitch attachment to the test mass.
Shorty Screamer completely deployed. No apparent damage to the daisy chain.
Significant difficulty removing girth hitch nylon welding noted at girth hitch. Eight bar tacks blown out.
No difficulty removing girth hitch no nylon welding noted at girth hitch. Seven bar tacks blown out.
Shorty Screamer completely deployed. No apparent damage to the daisy chain.
Four bar tacks blown apart before complete failure.
Shorty Screamer completely deployed. Fibers separating. Near failure of daisy chain.
Yates - Heavy Duty Daisy Chain - Black
Yates - Heavy Duty Daisy Chain - Black
Four bar tacks blown apart (proximal to anchor side).
Yates - Heavy Duty Daisy Chain - Black
Four bar tacks blown apart (anchor side). One bar tack torn on load side. Heavy fusing at girth hitch.
Rigged per manufacturers instructions. Minor chafe at girth hitch. No other apparent damage.
Failed in first link after the girth hitch at the load end. Failed in the webbing link - not the stitching.
Same failure location as in drop test #5.
Purcell adjusted to its shortest configuration. Prusik appropriately snug (e.g. hear the friction). Light chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Light chafe/glaze at prusik location.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Light to moderate chafe at figure 8. Light to moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Light to moderate chafe at figure 8. Light to moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Same set up as drops 8-10 except 2-wrap prusik (shortest configuration, snug prusik, etc.) Light chafe at girth hitch. Light chafe at figure 8. Light to moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Light chafe at figure 8. Light to moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.

The test included a carabiner-clip from the primary attachment loop back to the girth hitch location. This configuration resulted in a shorter lanyard length and no slippage of the prusik hitch. Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik. Some sheath damage at girth hitch.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light to moderate chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Light chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Sheath stripped on one strand at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate to heavy chafe/glaze at prusik.
Shorty Screamer fully deployed. Girth hitch easy to undo.Daisy stitching coming apart at anchor end.

Shorty Screamer fully deployed. Daisy failed in strand near Screamer girth hitch connection. Only the stub of bar tacking that wedged itself into the Screamer girth hitch connection prevented the load from grounding.
Failed in a bar tacked location.
Near failure. Fibers separating at first bar tack.
Clipped two pockets side by side. Demonstrating an incorrect attachment method, but one that is commonly observed to be used in the field. No apparent damage.
Same set up as drop test #27. No failure.
Same set up as drop tests #27 & 28. Tore through one and a half of three bar tacks.
Same set up as drop tests #27 - 29. Failed.
Nylon Webbing adjustable cam buckle - Nylon -
Full deployment of Shorty Screamer. Deformation of buckle. Moderate damage to webbing under the cam.
Soaked in water for 5 minutes and left outside overnight (-2º C). Stiff prior to drop test.
One pocket blown out at anchor end.
Two bar tacks blown out at anchor end.
Screamer fully deployed. No bar tacks blown out on daisy.
No apparent damage. Light chafing at girth hitch.
No pockets blown. Light chafing at girth hitch.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Light chafe at figure 8. Light chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Light chafe at figure 8. Light to moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Light to moderate chafe at figure 8. Light to moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.

The test included a carabiner-clip from the primary attachment loop back to the girth hitch location. Similar to the test set up in drop #14. Primary difference was that the prusik hitch was set midway along its adjustable length to allow for some slippage.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Very light chafe at figure 8. Negligible chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Light chafe at figure 8. Light chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light to moderate chafe at girth hitch. Light to moderate chafe at figure 8. Light chafe/glaze at prusik.
Negligible chafe at girth hitch. Negligible chafe at figure 8. Light chafe/glaze at prusik.
Light chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Moderate chafe at girth hitch. Moderate chafe at figure 8. Moderate chafe/glaze at prusik.
Some light webbing cutting noted where girth hitch loop links to adjacent sewn link.
Some light webbing cutting noted where girth hitch loop links to adjacent sewn link.
No apparent damage except moderate chafe at girth hitch.
